author: @unosantafe
title: El presidente del PJ santafesino se expres\u00f3 en contra de la interna nacional y adelant\u00f3 que no apoyar\u00e1 ninguna lista
text: El Partido Justicialista tendrÃ¡ elecciones internas luego de 36 aÃ±os. Por un lado estarÃ¡ la ex presidenta Cristina FernÃ¡ndez de Kirchner, mientras que la otra lista es liderada por el gobernador de La Rioja, Ricardo Quintela. Pero [el presidente del PJ Santa Fe](https://www.unosantafe.com.ar/politica/kicillof-rompio-el-silencio-las-internas-el-partido-justicialista-y-llamo-la-unidad-n10159604.html), Guillermo Cornaglia, se expresÃ³ en contra de la interna, asegurando que lo mejor hubiera sido una lista de unidad, como ocurriÃ³ en diversas provincias, entre ellas Santa Fe. El presidente del PJ santafesino se expresÃ³ en contra de la interna nacional y adelantÃ³ que no apoyarÃ¡ ninguna lista Guillermo Cornaglia considerÃ³ que era mejor una lista de unidad, en rechazo al enfrentamiento entre Cristina FernÃ¡ndez de Kirchner y Ricardo Quintela. "Desde lo nacional deberÃ­an imitar lo que se hizo en muchas provincias, inclusive en nuestra provincia de Santa Fe, donde absolutamente todos los sectores nos pusimos de acuerdo, por supuesto resignando cada uno algo para que esta unidad se haya podido dar en la provincia. Es una unidad que incluye y que dentro del Consejo Ejecutivo Provincial contiene absolutamente a todos los sectores del Partido Justicialista de Santa Fe", dijo el ex senador. [LEER MÃS: La interna del PJ tambiÃ©n se juega en Santa Fe: casi 200 mil afiliados podrÃ¡n elegir entre CFK o Quintela](https://www.unosantafe.com.ar/politica/la-interna-del-pj-tambien-se-juega-santa-fe-casi-200-mil-afiliados-podran-elegir-cfk-o-quintela-n10160164.html) "Con como estÃ¡ nuestro paÃ­s, como estÃ¡ nuestra gente descreÃ­da, desalentada, necesitada, lo menos que necesita es una pelea intestina de los partidos. Es una simple y humilde opiniÃ³n de quien hoy le toca presidir el Partido Justicialista de la provincia de Santa Fe, pero que lo hemos hecho a travÃ©s de la unidad de todos los sectores. Hoy la gente estÃ¡ preocupada por haber perdido su trabajo, por no llegar a mitad de mes, esa es la preocupaciÃ³n de la gente hoy, y no quiÃ©n conduce o dirige un determinado partido. La gente quiere soluciones, no mÃ¡s problemas y mucho menos mÃ¡s peleas", rechazÃ³ en una entrevista por LT10. Acerca de alguna preferencia por las listas que se presentan, Cornaglia sentenciÃ³: "Nosotros como partido no vamos a tomar ninguna definiciÃ³n. Dentro del partido hay distintos sectores que algunos estÃ¡n en una lista y otros estÃ¡n en otra. Tomar la decisiÃ³n por uno u otro sector serÃ­a romper esta unidad. Yo creo que para que esta unidad se mantenga, el Partido Justicialista debe mantenerse imparcial, y que sean absolutamente los afiliados los que tomen la decisiÃ³n". Â¿Cristina en Santa Fe? Sobre la posibilidad de que Cristina FernÃ¡ndez recorra la ciudad, tal como lo hizo hace algunas semanas Ricardo Quintela, Cornaglia asegurÃ³ que "las puertas del Partido Justicialista estÃ¡n abiertas absolutamente para todos los compaÃ±eros de nuestro paÃ­s". "De la misma manera que recibimos al gobernador de La Rioja en oportunidad de su visita por la provincia, siempre estarÃ¡n abiertas las puertas en caso de que la ex presidenta de la NaciÃ³n quiera hacerlo. El Partido Justicialista es de todos los justicialistas, independientemente de cualquier diferencia", enfatizÃ³. Con respecto al financiamiento de las elecciones, Cornaglia dijo que "es innecesario el gasto, financie y quien financie, mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de la ley partidaria que todos los partidos reciben en Ã©pocas electorales por parte del gobierno".

author: Elmer Recuerdo
title: â€˜Abandonedâ€™ insurgent leads arms cache recovery
text:
CATBALOGAN CITY â€” An individual believed to be a member of the New Peopleâ€™s Army who was abandoned by his fleeing comrades during an encounter led government troops to the place where the communist guerillas hid their firearms and ammunition.
The encounter happened between troops from the 43rd Infantry â€œWe Searchâ€ Battalion and a squad of NPA in the hinterlands of Barangay Palanit, San Isidro, Northern Samar, last 27 January 2024.
A report from the 8th Infantry Division said the troop captured alias Doming/Nitoy, a member of Squad 1, Sub-Regional Guerilla Unit, Sub-Regional Committee Emporium, Eastern Visayas Regional Party Committee.
He was found to have a standing warrant of arrest for the crime of murder issued by the Regional Trial Court Branch 20 on 10 October 2015.
The 8ID said that prior to the encounter, the troops were conducting a focused military operation after receiving information from the residents about the presence of an armed group extorting residents in the said barangay, when they were fired upon by the group of alias Doming.
When the communist guerillas retreated, Doming was left behind and was subsequently captured by the government troops.
During an interview, Doming revealed the location of an arms cache of the NPA in the hinterlands of Sitio Kahidwangan, Barangay Happy Valley, San Isidro, Northern Samar. Seized were an M16 rifle and a short plastic magazine.
Lieutenant Colonel Nasser Arojo, Commanding Officer of the 43IB, attributed the success of the operation to the timely and relevant information provided by the residents as he acknowledged that the cooperation of the residents led to the capture of alias Doming and the recovery of the arms cache containing high-powered firearms.
â€œThis is a clear indication that the community appreciates the efforts of the government and has decided to support the fight of ending the local communist armed conflict,â€ Arojo said.
Meanwhile, 8th Infantry Division commanding general Major General Camilo Z. Ligayo also encouraged the remaining communist guerillas and the community to unite and work together towards the upliftment of socio-economic conditions especially in far-flung communities.

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: â€˜The ruling of the Supreme Court of Venezuela is a farce,â€™ says Juan Manuel Santos after the revalidation of NicolÃ¡s Maduroâ€™s electoral victory
text:
AND Former Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos, Nobel Peace Prize winner in 2016, described the decision of the Supreme Court of Justice of Venezuela (TSJ) as a â€œhoaxâ€ on Thursday. controlled by magistrates close to Chavez, which confirmed the questioned results of the elections that gave victory to NicolÃ¡s Maduro.
According to the criteria of â€œThe ruling of the Supreme Court of Venezuela is a farce. Colombia cannot, nor should it endorse it, as we told the Foreign Minister (Luis Gilberto) Murillo yesterday in the Foreign Relations Advisory Commission,â€ said Santos, who governed the Andean country between 2010 and 2018, in a message posted on the social network X.
The ruling of the Supreme Court of Venezuela is a farce. Colombia cannot and should not endorse it, as we told Foreign Minister Murillo yesterday at the Foreign Relations Advisory Committee.
â€” Juan Manuel Santos (@JuanManSantos) August 22, 2024
The ruling, which â€œunequivocally and unrestrictivelyâ€ concludes the review of the elections, comes 22 days after Maduro himself requested this process, through an appeal for protection that was never heard and through which the 10 former presidential candidates were summoned to the TSJ.
Before the TSJ issued its ruling, The standard-bearer of the largest opposition coalition, the Democratic Unitary Platform (PUD), Edmundo GonzÃ¡lez Urrutia, warned that the judicial decision â€œwill only aggravate the crisisâ€ that the country is experiencing.
The PUD maintains that its candidate won the presidential election by a wide margin and published â€œ83.5% of the electoral recordsâ€ to reinforce its claim, which has been supported by several countries and national and international organizations.
However, the National Electoral Council (CNE) declared Maduro the winner, without having published the disaggregated results, a point that was contemplated in the schedule of the contest, which has been demanded by a large part of the international community.
The TSJâ€™s recognition of the alleged victory of the satrap NicolÃ¡s Maduro on July 28 is a blow to the Venezuelan people, to the democratic resistance led by @MariaCorinaYA to the millions of citizens who yearn for change and to the courageous electoral witnessesâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/MtqU3VKbaa
â€” IvÃ¡n Duque ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡´ (@IvanDuque) August 22, 2024
What Ivan Duque said Former Colombian President IvÃ¡n Duque, who led a â€œdiplomatic siegeâ€ against the Maduro government between 2018 and 2022 and broke relations with the neighboring country, described the TSJâ€™s decision as â€œ â€œa blow to the Venezuelan people, to the sovereign expression of a country that wants to say enough to the dictatorship.â€
â€œNow what the dictator hopes is that based on this ruling, which has no basis or support, and which also ends up validating that the National Electoral Council was at his service in stealing the elections, several countries sympathetic to his dictatorship in the international community will come out to recognize him as the legitimate president,â€ Duque added on the social network X.
The former president also asked Colombia, Mexico and Brazil â€“ who work as mediators in the Venezuelan crisis â€“ recognize â€œthe victoryâ€ of GonzÃ¡lez and the validity of the minutes published by the opposition, as well as condemn â€œnot only this outburst of the submissive court of justice, but also all this trickery so that Maduro remains in power.â€
#ruling #Supreme #Court #Venezuela #farce #Juan #Manuel #Santos #revalidation #NicolÃ¡s #Maduros #electoral #victory

organizations.name: supreme court of justice of venezuela

author: McKenzy Parsons
title: KETV viewers capture breathtaking photos of Northern Lights over Nebraska, Iowa
text: KETV viewers looked to the skies on Thursday evening, capturing stunning photos of the Northern Lights.Check out this view from Modale, Iowa.Justin Mensik saw this wonderful view from Morse Bluff.A viewer shared this with KETV on Facebook from Wisner.Kelly Wessel saw this amazing view in Schleswig, Iowa.Ashley Buneta captured this in the Council Bluffs area.KETV's own Scott Buer found the most beautiful sight in Underwood, Iowa.Viewer Summer Miller took this photo in Elkhorn.Lori Wilson found a magnificent sight in Honey Creek.Susan Laughlin captured this in Blair.Eric Richey saw this amazing view from the Ponca State Park.

author: Amira EL MASAITI
title: Report lists Morocco among most dangerous countries for solo female travelers
text: A new report by World Population Review has ranked Morocco as the eighth most dangerous country for solo female travelers in 2024. The report reveals that 45% of Moroccan women experience physical or sexual violence from an intimate partner, the highest rate among the countries surveyed. Additionally, 32% of Moroccan women believe that violence against women is justified under certain circumstances, placing Morocco tenth in this category. The country also ranks tenth for legal discrimination against women. These findings are consistent with recent data from the Higher Planning Commission (HCP), which shows that 57% of Moroccan women have experienced violence. Most of this violence occurs in marital and family settings (52.1%), followed by educational (18.9%) and professional environments (15.4%). Violence in public spaces is less common, at 12.6%. South Africa is identified as the most dangerous country for female solo travelers, followed by Brazil, Russia, Mexico, Iran, the Dominican Republic, Morocco, India, and Thailand. In contrast, Spain, Singapore, Ireland, Austria, Switzerland, Norway, Portugal, Croatia, Canada, and Poland are ranked as the safest countries for women. The study, conducted by journalists Asher and Lyric Fergusson, assessed the 50 most popular tourist destinations based on factors such as street safety, homicide rates, sexual violence, legal discrimination, and general attitudes towards violence against women. The report also notes the tragic case of two tourists murdered in Imlil in late 2018, highlighting the risks faced by solo female travelers in Morocco.

author: Evelyn Blackwell
title: Mr Whippy van axes ice cream prices after being accused of â€˜taking the p**sâ€™ â€“ WorldNewsEra
text: It used to be an affordable staple of a family day out. But any parent who's stood in front of an ice cream van or stall this summer will probably have been taken aback by 2024 prices.But one ice cream van in particular has drawn criticism from families who claim they can't afford the 'shocking' prices. A price list for the van, based at a popular family park, was shared on Facebook as a warning to other parents to 'steer clear with the kids'.The list shows prices started at Â£3.95 for a basic 99 cone, rising to Â£5.95 for a Knickerbocker Sunday and Â£6.95 for a King Cone, prompting hundreds of people to criticise the seller for the 'unbelievable' prices, MEN reports."We saw many kids crying the other day because their mum just couldn't afford it," said one local resident of the Mr Whippy van in Wythenshawe Park in Manchester. "Everyone is out to make a profit but this is taking the p**s."Another person commented: "I understand they have a fee to pay for that spot and need to cover that, but these are like festival prices and not even worth it."A third person added: "How are families supposed to go on cheap days out with these prices? Daylight robbery! He should be ashamed of himself."One customer claimed there was no price list when they visited the van, which is parked next to the children's playground, and were shocked when the bill came to Â£11.25 for two ice creams.Manchester City Council said it was 'engaging with the operator' of the Royal Ices van and 'addressing concerns' that have been raised. And when a joournalist from the MEN went to visit the van, they noticed prices had dropped, with two standard waffle cone 99s now costing Â£7.The classic 99 had been cut to Â£3.25, or a mere Â£2.75 without a Flake, while the Knickerbocker Sunday was down considerably to Â£3.95 and the King Cone had dropped to Â£6.A Manchester council spokesperson commented: "Affordability is a key strand of our assessment process for the procurement of partners.Through the contracting process we will work with operators to make sure their prices are fair and affordable for our residents."A Manchester council spokesperson commented: "Affordability is a key strand of our assessment process for the procurement of partners. Through the contracting process we will work with operators to make sure their prices are fair and affordable for our residents."
